ghost

Class Waka

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.Waka

  • public class Waka
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents waka object in game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a new Waka object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Waka

        public Waka(processing.core.PImage playerClosed,
            processing.core.PImage playerDown,
            processing.core.PImage playerLeft,
            processing.core.PImage playerRight,
            processing.core.PImage playerUp,
            Fruit fruits,
            Config config)
        Constructs a new Waka object.
        Parameters:
        playerClosed - PImage of waka with closed mouth.
        playerDown - PImage of waka facing downwards.
        playerLeft - PImage of waka facing towards the left.
        playerRight - PImage of waka facing towards the right.
        playerUp - PImage of waka facing upwards.
        fruits - Object of type Fruit.
        config - Object of type Config.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public long getX()
        Returns the current x-axis position of waka.
        Returns:
        x-axis position of waka.

      • getY

        public long getY()
        Returns the current y-axis position of waka.
        Returns:
        y-axis position of waka.

      • getMovingDirection

        public java.lang.String getMovingDirection()
        Returns the direction in which the waka is moving.
        Returns:
        Direction of waka.

      • move

        public void move(int code,
                 int frameCount)
        Method to move the waka based on the keycode of the key pressed by the player.
        Parameters:
        code - Keycode
        frameCount - Frame count

      • direction

        public boolean direction(int keyCode)
        This function checks and returns whether waka can move in the direction specified by keycode or not. It also checks if waka is eating any fruit, or superfruit when moving in that direction or not. It returns true if waka can move in that direction, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Key code of the key pressed.
        Returns:
        Outcome of trying to move waka in that direction.

      • moveUp

        public boolean moveUp()
        This function tries to move waka upwards. It returns false if waka collided with wall when doing so, else it returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move upwards or not.

      • moveDown

        public boolean moveDown()
        This function tries to move waka downwards. It returns false if waka collided with wall when doing so, else it returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move downwards or not.

      • moveRight

        public boolean moveRight()
        This function tries to move waka towards right. It returns false if waka collided with wall when doing so, else it returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move right or not.

      • moveLeft

        public boolean moveLeft()
        This function tries to move waka towards left. It returns false if waka collided with wall when doing so, else it returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move left or not.

      • die

        public void die()
        This function is called when waka dies. It resets the position, number of lives, and the initial starting PImage of waka.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Checking if waka is alive or not. Waka is alive if it has lives left. It returns true if waka has lives left, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether waka is alive or not.

      • collisonUp

        public boolean collisonUp(long wallTop,
                          long wallBottom,
                          long wallLeft,
                          long wallRight,
                          long wakaTop,
                          long wakaBottom,
                          long wakaLeft,
                          long wakaRight)
        Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of waka, and wall that they are colliding or not when waka is trying to move upwards. It returns true if the waka collides with wall, when it tries to move upwards, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        wallTop - Coordinates of the top of wall grid.
        wallBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of wall grid.
        wallLeft - Coordinates of the left side of wall grid.
        wallRight - Coordinates of the right of wall grid.
        wakaTop - Coordinates of the top of waka.
        wakaBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of waka.
        wakaLeft - Coordinates of the left side of waka.
        wakaRight - Coordinates of the right side of waka.
        Returns:
        Outcome of waka trying to move upwards.

      • collisonDown

        public boolean collisonDown(long wallTop,
                            long wallBottom,
                            long wallLeft,
                            long wallRight,
                            long wakaTop,
                            long wakaBottom,
                            long wakaLeft,
                            long wakaRight)
        Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of waka, and wall that they are colliding or not when waka is trying to move downwards. It returns true if the waka collides with wall, when it tries to move downwards, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        wallTop - Coordinates of the top of wall grid.
        wallBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of wall grid.
        wallLeft - Coordinates of the left side of wall grid.
        wallRight - Coordinates of the right of wall grid.
        wakaTop - Coordinates of the top of waka.
        wakaBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of waka.
        wakaLeft - Coordinates of the left side of waka.
        wakaRight - Coordinates of the right side of waka.
        Returns:
        Outcome of waka trying to move downwards.

                             long wallBottom,

                             long wakaBottom,
                             long wakaLeft,
                             long wakaRight)
        Checking for different top, bottom, left, and right values of waka, and wall that they are colliding or not when waka is trying to move towards left. It returns true if the waka collides with wall, when it tries to move left, else it returns false.
        Parameters:
        wallTop - Coordinates of the top of wall grid.
        wallBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of wall grid.
        wallLeft - Coordinates of the left side of wall grid.
        wallRight - Coordinates of the right of wall grid.
        wakaTop - Coordinates of the top of waka.
        wakaBottom - Coordinates of the bottom of waka.
        wakaLeft - Coordinates of the left side of waka.
        wakaRight - Coordinates of the right side of waka.
        Returns:
        Outcome of waka trying to move left.

      • isCollidingUp

        public boolean isCollidingUp()
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and waka, and checks if it is colliding when waka tries to move upwards or not. It returns true if the waka is able to move upwards without colliding, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move upwards or not.

      • isCollidingDown

        public boolean isCollidingDown()
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and waka, and checks if it is colliding when waka tries to move downwards or not. It returns true if the waka is able to move downwards without colliding, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move downwards or not.

      • isCollidingRight

        public boolean isCollidingRight()
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and waka, and checks if it is colliding when waka tries to move towards right or not. It returns true if the waka is able to move towards right without colliding, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move right or not.

      • isCollidingLeft

        public boolean isCollidingLeft()
        This method calculates the top, bottom, left, and right position of wall, and waka, and checks if it is colliding when waka tries to move towards left or not. It returns true if the waka is able to move towards left without colliding, else it returns false.
        Returns:
        Whether waka can move left or not.

      • isCollidingFruitsLeft

        public void isCollidingFruitsLeft(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fruitsListt,
                                  java.lang.String type)
        This method calculates the centre coordinates of waka, and checks if it collides with any fruit in the fruits, and super fruits list when waka is trying to move left. It decides whether to remove from fruits list, or super fruits list based on the type parameter. type parameter "simple" refers to simple fruits list, while "super" refers to super fruits list.
        Parameters:
        fruitsListt - List of fruits, or superfruits with which colliding needs to be checked.
        type - String telling the type of fruit.

      • isCollidingFruitsRight

        public void isCollidingFruitsRight(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fruitsListt,
                                   java.lang.String type)
        This method calculates the centre coordinates of waka, and checks if it collides with any fruit in the fruits, and super fruits list when waka is trying to move right. It decides whether to remove from fruits list, or super fruits list based on the type parameter. type parameter "simple" refers to simple fruits list, while "super" refers to super fruits list.
        Parameters:
        fruitsListt - List of fruits, or superfruits with which colliding needs to be checked.
        type - String telling the type of fruit.

      • isCollidingFruitsDown

        public void isCollidingFruitsDown(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fruitsListt,
                                  java.lang.String type)
        This method calculates the centre coordinates of waka, and checks if it collides with any fruit in the fruits, and super fruits list when waka is trying to move downwards. It decides whether to remove from fruits list, or super fruits list based on the type parameter. type parameter "simple" refers to simple fruits list, while "super" refers to super fruits list.
        Parameters:
        fruitsListt - List of fruits, or superfruits with which colliding needs to be checked.
        type - String telling the type of fruit.

      • isCollidingFruitsUp

        public void isCollidingFruitsUp(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fruitsListt,
                                java.lang.String type)
        This method calculates the centre coordinates of waka, and checks if it collides with any fruit in the fruits, and super fruits list when waka is trying to move upwards. It decides whether to remove from fruits list, or super fruits list based on the type parameter. type parameter "simple" refers to simple fruits list, while "super" refers to super fruits list.
        Parameters:
        fruitsListt - List of fruits, or superfruits with which colliding needs to be checked.
        type - String telling the type of fruit.

      • close

        public void close()
        This method changes the PImage of waka to closed.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        It is the draw method which is called sixty (frame rate) times per second.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        It is the draw method which is called sixty (frame rate) times per second. It draws the image of waka on the screen at its position using the required PImage.
        Parameters:
        app - PApplet app object.
